title: How to Make a Cardboard Box Storage System

steps.headline: Get the boxes.
steps.description:
If you can't find them locally, look online. You can use any measurements you want, as long as four long boxes (drawers) fit into one cubic box (compartment). Here are some suggested measurements and quantities: 25 to 500 cubic boxes - 13 x 13 x 13 inches (33 x 33 x 33 cm){"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1d/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1d/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} 25 to 900 long boxes - 12 x 6 x 6 inches (30.5 x 15.25 x 15.25 cm){"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/34/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/34/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"}

steps.headline: Assemble the cubic boxes into a shelving unit.
Assemble the long boxes, which will be drawers.
steps.description: Cut out a square at one end of the box. Four drawers fit in one compartment.

steps.headline: Load your inventory in the drawers.

text:
Get the boxes. If you can't find them locally, look online. You can use any measurements you want, as long as four long boxes (drawers) fit into one cubic box (compartment). Here are some suggested measurements and quantities: 25 to 500 cubic boxes - 13 x 13 x 13 inches (33 x 33 x 33 cm){"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1d/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1d/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} 25 to 900 long boxes - 12 x 6 x 6 inches (30.5 x 15.25 x 15.25 cm){"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/34/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/34/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Assemble the cubic boxes into a shelving unit. Cut the flaps on one side. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2b/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2b/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Tape the cubes together - front, back and side. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/53/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/53/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} When taping is completed, put the completed shelving unit against a wall. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2c/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2c/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Assemble the long boxes, which will be drawers. Cut out a square at one end of the box. Four drawers fit in one compartment. Load your inventory in the drawers. Write the description on the box. Then, put the drawers in so that the order makes sense. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/91/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/91/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Sort the drawers alphabetically. Alternatively, sort the drawers so that things you use most often are at arm level, easiest to reach, and things that are less frequently used are lower or higher. Slide the drawers into the compartments. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f1/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-4Bullet4.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-4Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f1/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-4Bullet4.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-4Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Use compartments without the drawers for larger objects. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/24/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-4Bullet5.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-4Bullet5.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/24/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-4Bullet5.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-4Bullet5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Use small containers to store small objects. These are tennis ball cans. Check with your local tennis club - you might get hundreds of them for free.
sentences: Get the boxes.
If you can't find them locally, look online.
You can use any measurements you want, as long as four long boxes (drawers) fit into one cubic box (compartment).

Here are some suggested measurements and quantities: 25 to 500 cubic boxes - 13 x 13 x 13 inches (33 x 33 x 33 cm){"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1d/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1d/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} 25 to 900 long boxes - 12 x 6 x 6 inches (30.5 x 15.25 x 15.25 cm){"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/34/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/34/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Assemble the cubic boxes into a shelving unit.
Cut the flaps on one side.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/2b\/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/2b\/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Tape the cubes together - front, back and side.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/53\/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-2Bullet2.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/53\/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-2Bullet2.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} When taping is completed, put the completed shelving unit against a wall.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/2c\/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-2Bullet3.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/2c\/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-2Bullet3.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Assemble the long boxes, which will be drawers.
Cut out a square at one end of the box.
Four drawers fit in one compartment.
Load your inventory in the drawers.
Write the description on the box.
Then, put the drawers in so that the order makes sense.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/91\/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/91\/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Sort the drawers alphabetically.
Alternatively, sort the drawers so that things you use most often are at arm level, easiest to reach, and things that are less frequently used are lower or higher.
Slide the drawers into the compartments.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f1\/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-4Bullet4.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-4Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f1\/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-4Bullet4.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-4Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Use compartments without the drawers for larger objects.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/24\/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-4Bullet5.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-4Bullet5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/24\/Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-4Bullet5.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Cardboard-Box-Storage-System-Step-4Bullet5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Use small containers to store small objects.
These are tennis ball cans.
Check with your local tennis club - you might get hundreds of them for free.
